com.payvment.continuuity
Class SocialActionFlow

java.lang.Object
  com.payvment.continuuity.SocialActionFlow
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.continuuity.api.flow.Flow
public class SocialActionFlow
extends Object
implements com.continuuity.api.flow.Flow

Flow application used to process Lish social actions in order to generate activity feeds and popular feeds of products.

This currently generates activity and popular feeds on a per-product-category basis.

Flow Design

Input

The input to this Flow is a stream named social-actions which contains social action events in JSON format. More information about the schema of these events can be found in SocialAction.

Flowlets

This Flow is made up of four Flowlets.

The first flowlet, SocialActionParserFlowlet, is responsible for parsing the social action JSON into the internal representation (as an instance of a SocialAction passed through a Tuple).

The second Flowlet, SocialActionFlow.SocialActionProcessorFlowlet, performs the primary processing and is responsible for the initial counter and score updates to all of the necessary tables. Counters are used to determine the total score and hourly score for this product.

Results from these operations, specifically the total and hourly scores, are then passed on to the remaining two Flowlets, SocialActionFlow.ActivityFeedUpdaterFlowlet and SocialActionFlow.PopularFeedUpdaterFlowlet, for final processing and insertion into the two respective feeds as required.

See the javadoc of each Flowlet class for more detailed information.

Tables

This Flow utilizes four Tables.

productActions is an instance of a CounterTable used to track the number of times each social action type has occurred for every individual product. The primary key on this table is product_id.

allTimeScores is another instance of a CounterTable used to track the total score over all time of a given product.

topScores is an instance of a SortedCounterTable used to track the scores of each product on an hourly basis and provides score sorting capabilities to allow retrieving the top-n scored products for a given hour and category.

activityFeeds is an instance of an ActivityFeedTable used to store descending time-ordered feeds of products. (NOTE: This is not yet implemented as a separate table, coming soon)

See the javadoc of each table class for more detailed information.

Nested Class Summary
static class SocialActionFlow.ActivityFeedUpdaterFlowlet
          Flowlet that performs checks of values generated in the primary updates and determines whether to insert an activity feed entry.
static class SocialActionFlow.PopularFeedUpdaterFlowlet
          Flowlet that performs checks of values generated in the primary updates and determines whether to perform any additional insertions for the popular feed, and if so, performs those operations.
static class SocialActionFlow.SocialActionProcessorFlowlet
          Flowlet that performs the primary updates to counters that track the all time and hourly scores of products.

Constant Field Values

SOCIAL_ACTION_TUPLE_SCHEMA

public static final com.continuuity.api.flow.flowlet.TupleSchema SOCIAL_ACTION_TUPLE_SCHEMA
Tuple schema used between SocialActionParserFlowlet and SocialActionFlow.SocialActionProcessorFlowlet.

Schema contains only a SocialAction object.

PROCESSED_ACTION_TUPLE_SCHEMA

public static final com.continuuity.api.flow.flowlet.TupleSchema PROCESSED_ACTION_TUPLE_SCHEMA
Tuple schema used between SocialActionFlow.SocialActionProcessorFlowlet and the two connecting Flowlets, SocialActionFlow.ActivityFeedUpdaterFlowlet and SocialActionFlow.PopularFeedUpdaterFlowlet.

Schema contains a SocialAction object, the score increase for this event, and Long values derived from the results of counter increment operations performed by the processor. Specifically, these values are the all-time total score and the hourly score of the product in the social action.
